ygData.subject: DarkMouse
ygData.msgSnippet: DarkMouse:: She cried out as a lazar blast sliced the side of her mouse shoulder. She turned and saw the lazars firing on her.  She transformed into bot mode

Subject: DarkMouse

DarkMouse::

She cried out as a lazar blast sliced the side of her mouse shoulder. 
She turned and saw the lazars firing on her.  She transformed into 
bot mode and ran for cover.  She dove behind a large rock and hid 
from the autocannons.  She groaned at the pain in her shoulder.  She 
looked around. "Those auto defence systems shouldn't have kicked in 
unless there is a maximal out here. Well, I'm not staying here and 
letting some crazied maximal take me out. I'll just have to get them 
before they get me."  She turned on her scanner and checked the area. 
A strange maximal signature showed up on her scanner. It was right 
there were she was.  She grabbed her photon pistol,jumped up and 
looked around. IN jumping up, the auto lazars homed in on her and 
fired.  She ducked back behind the rock. "OK Maximal, come out and 
surrender. Your out numbered and out gunned."  But there was no 
answer. The ships Autoguns fired a large plasma round at her.  It 
went up in a big explosion a few yards away from her.  She screamed 
in fear and went running away from the ship as fast as she could. 

It took her a few minutes and some fancy foot work to get out of the 
hail of lazar fire.  She fell to her knees and tried to catch her 
breath. She checked her scanners again, hoping the maximal that had 
set off the autosystems wasn't anywhere near her. The blip on the 
scanner showed her and that maximal signature standing right next to 
each other.  She grabbed her gun again and looked around. NO one was 
around. Yet this strange maximal signal was right there. Her scanner 
couldn't be malfunctioning, could it?  She looked around and sniffed 
the air. She could smell the after scent of lazar fire, but no other 
bots near by.  She looked at her shoulder and saw the glowing mech 
fluid oozing out of the wound.  She winced and groaned. "This just 
isn't my day."  She shook her head and started walking.  She didn't 
know where she was going, or in what direction.  She just walked away 
from the ship. Perhaps Galvatron had set off the system and just 
didn't want her around anymore?  She couldn't figure out what had set 
off the systems. She stayed in bot mode and kept walking.
